sentence.Network_en: Snapdragons , calceolaria and larkspur will drop their floret rapidly.

sentence.Network_en: Floret few people in the room quietly waiting for news.
sentence.Network_cn: 小花几个人在房间里静静等候消息.

sentence.Network_en: Xinjiang ethnic costumes, hats floret in Xinjiang, the Xinjiang nuts.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Latin flos, flor- 'flower' + -et

entry.def: On a flowering plant, a floret is a small flower that is part of a larger flower.
On vegetables such as broccoli and cauliflower, a floret is one of the small, flower-shaped pieces which make up the part of the vegetable that you eat.

means.word_mean: 1. a diminutive flower (especially one that is part of a composite flower)

stems_affixes.value_cn: [植]过了开花期的, 已开过花的
stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+flor花+ate……的→adj.[植]过了开花期的, 已开过花的
flor花+id如……的→像花→像花一样的

stems_affixes.word_buile: de去掉+flor花+ation表名词→去掉花→摘花
flor花+a表示复数→花群→植物群
